text: Courtney Neron is an American politician from Oregon. A Democrat, she serves in the Oregon House of Representatives where she represents District 26. This district is located in northern Oregon and includes portions of Clackamas County and Washington County. She was first elected in 2018. ==Early life and career== Neron was born in Tigard, Oregon and attended the University of Oregon. She worked as a teacher. ==Political career== Neron was named as the replacement candidate for the district on July 28, 2018, after Ryan Spiker dropped out after winning the Democratic primary. In the general election, Neron defeated her Republican opponent, incumbent representative Rich Vial, securing 50.8% of the vote to become the new Representative for the district. With her election she became the first Democrat to represent the district in 18 years, the last being Kathy Lowe, who served in the Legislature from 2000 to 2002. ==Personal life== Neron lives in Wilsonville with her husband, Joe, and their two children. ==References== Category:Members of the Oregon House of Representatives Category:Living people Category:University of Oregon alumni Category:People from Wilsonville, Oregon Category:People from Tigard, Oregon Category:Educators from Oregon Category:Oregon Democrats Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Courtney Neron
